movies.title: Swiss Army Man
movies.description: This is a movie abount a man stranded on an island who befriends a farting corpse played by Daniel Radcliffe. I.... LOVE IT. Might not be everyone's cup of tea, but I promise you this has much more than just flatulance humor (otherwise I wouldn't like it either!). It makes me cry every time.

movies.title: Little Miss Sunshine
movies.description: This is jsut all-around a great, feel-good movie! There's not a single reason not to watch it, so do it!

movies.title: The Avengers
movies.description: If you're never going to watch any other Marvel movie, watch this one. It was awesome back then, and it still holds up as one of the best (if not the best) Marvel movie ever created IMO. It also has the whole (old) team, so it's a good introduction to the franchise!

movies.title: Spirit: Stallion of the Cimarron
movies.description: One of the best animated movies of all time. If you like horses and the Wild West, this is a must-watch. It also has fantastic music and a great story. Absolutely iconic movie. (The poster does not do it justice.)

movies.title: The Stag
movies.description: This used to be my favorite movie. I watched it for Andrew Scott, and didn't expect much, but it's SO funny and heartwarming. It still has a spot in my heart.

movies.title: The Hunger Games
movies.description: I don't think I have to say much about this except: Watch this if you haven't, and rewatch it if you have.

movies.title: Knives Out
movies.description: If you like 'whodunit's you will love this. Daniel Craig is fantastic in it, he has so much fun playing the role and it's really noticable.

movies.title: Jurassic Park
movies.description: DINOSAURS! JEFF GOLDBLUM! LAURA DERN! Have I mentioned dinosaurs? No but really, this is one of my favorite movies, it's a classic for a reason. And it's actually quite terrifying.

movies.title: Zodiac
movies.description: This is a perfect thriller movie. It's about the Zodiac killer, and not for the faint-hearted, but it's so good. I usually don't like over-long movies but this one is an exception because it keeps you on the edge of your seat for all of its 157 minutes of runtime.
movies.cw: based on a real serial killer; shows scenes of murder; mentions of pedophilia

movies.title: The Princess Bride
movies.description: This movie has a cult following and I 100% understand why. It's quite old, but the humor holds up, and the characters are very memorable. It feels like a fairy tale. And it's hilarious and very quotable.

movies.title: Crazy, Stupid, Love.
movies.description: This is my favorite rom-com! It's just miles ahead of any other rom-com. It focuses on more than just one couple, and the plot lines connect neatly together at the end. I highly recommend it!

movies.title: Jennifer's Body
movies.description: A quintessential sapphic movie with a great cast, absolutely perfect for spooky month. You can watch this even if you don't like scary movies.

movies.title: It
movies.description: My favorite horror movie, because it doesn't rely on the horror aspects to make it interesting! The focus here are the kids and their friendship, which really pays off because as a viewer you absolutely begin to love them. Watch the sequel too, I think it's just as good! Neither of them are very scary though, so don't watch this looking for a big thrill.

tv-shows.title: Doctor Who
tv-shows.description: If you haven't watched Doctor Who yet... What are you waiting for? It really is as amazing as everyone says! Make sure to start with the ninth doctor, though, don't skip him to get to David Tennant! My favorite doctors are 10 and 12, though I love every single one of them. God, this show has so much heart.

tv-shows.title: Our Flag Means Death
tv-shows.description: A great comedy with a cooky cast of characters. The queer romance between the main characters is the focus, and it's unbelievably well executed. This is one of the best shows of this decade so far, please watch it! Unfortunately it was cancelled after 2 seasons... I wonder why...

tv-shows.title: Good Omens
tv-shows.description: You've heard of this one, too, right? It's really good, especially Aziraphale (the angel) and Crowley (the demon). The runtime is quite short, so you have no excuse to not watch this! A third and final season will come out next year, I think.

tv-shows.title: What We Do In The Shadows
tv-shows.description: Genuinely the funniest show I've ever seen. All of the main characters are absolutely amazing (and queer), too! You should watch this if you like vampires, queer characters, and silly silly jokes.

tv-shows.title: Hannibal
tv-shows.genres: Crime, Horror, Drama, Mystery, Thriller, Queer
tv-shows.description: This show gave me brain worms 6 years ago and I'm still not over it. Super gorey, super queer, super quotable, super great show. Don't watch it if you're squeamish, otherwise go for it! It picks up quite fast after the first few episodes.
tv-shows.cw: heavy gore, murder, cannibalism, toxic relationships, and more

tv-shows.title: Star Trek
tv-shows.description: Yes, I fear I am a Nerd... But this show, I swear to god, it's so good. It's weird watching something THIS old, but it's interesting, and the show is genuinely good. The best thing about this are definitely the characters, especially Kirk, Spock and Bones. I love them sm.

tv-shows.title: Supernatural
tv-shows.description: You know I had to mention this one. Yes, I was one of the SPN girlies. This show has 15 long seasons, so it's quite a time investment, but you can start with the first 4 and then see if you want to continue. (Spoiler Alert: You will.) If you like dark urban fantasy and horror you will like this. The characters are also great!

tv-shows.title: Sherlock
tv-shows.description: Hands down one of the best shows I've ever seen, though the quality drops in the last season. But don't let that discourage you - If you haven't seen it, just watch it. It's so short (every season only has 3 long episodes), and it's so fucking good. Only con: it's queerbaitey!

tv-shows.title: Stranger Things
tv-shows.description: I used to refuse to watch this because 'i hate kids'. Don't be like me. This show is worth all the hype, and it's just getting better with each season. If you like friendships, 80s vibes and monsters, watch it!

tv-shows.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender
tv-shows.description: This is the best animated series ever created, and I don't think it will ever be dethroned. If you've been living under a rock and haven't seen this yet, just go ahead. Don't worry about it being 'childish', I promise even people who don't usually watch a lot of cartoons (like me) love this one. And it's not childish at all, it's hilarious AND deels with very serious topics like war.

tv-shows.title: Scrubs
tv-shows.description: This is the perfect balance between comedy and serious subject matters. It was the first medical show I was obsessed with, and I promise you you don't have to be interested in medical stuff to enjoy this a lot. Skip the last season, though.

tv-shows.title: Succession
tv-shows.description: This will have you on the edge of your seat. Don't just watch the first episode though: You will hate the characters and not want to continue. But you will grow to LOVE to hate these characters! There's lot of drama and cringefail dudes. I loved this so much more than I thought I would!
tv-shows.ifYouLike: contemporary drama, complicated family relationships and cringefail dudes

tv-shows.title: House MD
tv-shows.description: Here's my choice of medical drama. House's relationship with both Cuddy (his female boss) and Wilson (his male coworker) is insanity-inducing in the best way. Plus, he's really funny.
tv-shows.ifYouLike: medical shows, middle-aged characters and comedy-dramas
tv-shows.cw: heavy drug use; mentions of sickness, death, rape, etc.

tv-shows.title: Fleabag
tv-shows.description: Fleabag is the quintessential female experience. It's also fucking hilarious. It's VERY short so you have no excuse not to watch it. There is a hot priest in it too! By the way, this is cringe comedy, but as someone who usually doesn't like cringe comedy I can tell you that that should not be a reason not to watch it, I PROMISE!
tv-shows.ifYouLike: cringe comedy, hot priests and Andrew Scott

tv-shows.title: Crashing
tv-shows.description: From the creator and star of Fleabag. This is only 2 hours long but very fun! Also, there are some awesome queer characters!

tv-shows.title: Derry Girls
tv-shows.description: This short but sweet show is about a very lovable group of teens in Northern Ireland that get up to crazy stuff. The comedy is interspersed with serious, touching moments. I binged this in a few days and I'm so sad there's not more.
tv-shows.cw: mentions the historical context of military conflict, bombing, etc in passing; side character death

books.title: The Secret History
books.author: Donna Tartt
books.description: Do you like dark academia? Do you like fucked up characters that bond over horrible things? Do you enjoy hating characters? Are you insane? If you've answered Yes to any of these questions, read this book. It's long, but it's worth it.

books.title: 20,000 Leagues Under the Sea
books.author: Jules Verne
books.description: It's an old book, and it takes you on a journey through the world's oceans. Some sections are a bit boring (mostly descriptions of various sea creatures), but everything else is great. Read it if you like retro-futurism.

books.title: The Martian
books.author: Andy Weir
books.description: The perfect book for if you're in a reading slump, because it's hilarious from literally the first sentence on, and it never gets boring. I highly recommend the audio book too!

books.title: Watership Down
books.author: Richard Adams
books.description: Do you like Warrior Cats? Well, here's something similar but with rabbits! It's quite gorey and even scary at times, nothing for children! Also watch the classic movie.
books.cw: violence, death, vivid description of small spaces

books.title: Harry Potter
books.description: Yeah. It's awesome. What can I say. Fuck the author. Fun fact: I'm one of those rare people whose favorite character is Harry.

books.title: Warriors
books.author: Erin Hunter
books.description: I read this series as a kid and recently re-read it, thinking that it's going to be childish, but it wasn't. It holds up very well. The plot and the characters are just great. If you like cats (who doesn't? let's be real) read it!
books.cw: kid-friendly descriptions of violence and death

books.title: The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-Time
books.author: Mark Haddon
books.description: This used to be my favorite book. It's a quick read, and I really like it. There's not much more I can say to it. Time to re-read it. Again.

books.title: Flowers in the Attic
books.author: V.C. Andrews
books.description: I once googled 'What's the most fucked up book?' and this came up. I read it, and it did not disappoint. It's really, really fucking good though.
books.cw: all kinds of abuse, incent, death

books.title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
books.author: Yuval Noah Harari
books.description: My favorite non-fiction book. I picked this up without knowing anything about it because it was on sale, and it blew my mind. I love the first section especially, which is about pre-history. This book changed the way I look at life.

books.title: Sex at Dawn
books.author: Christopher Ryan, Cacilda Jeth√°
books.description: This is a great non-fiction book about human sexuality. The focus lies on how polyamory is natural, and monogamy is cultural. As a polyamorous person, this gave me so much joy. I'M NORMAL, YOU'RE THE WEIRD ONES.

games.title: Portal 2
games.description: This is the best video game ever created. The singleplayer mode is perfect, the co-op mode is perfect, the humor is on point, the graphics hold up really well, and it's so much fun.

games.title: Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild
games.description: One hell of an open-world game. This was the first LOZ game I've ever played, and it blew my mind. I even prefer it over its sequel.

games.title: Minecraft
games.description: I've spent most of my early teen years playing this game. Absolutely worth it.

games.title: Animal Crossing: New Horizons
games.description: I played this for more than 300 hours and enjoyed it a lot! It does get boring at some point, but apparently not in the first 300 hours so you're good.

games.title: Papers, Please
games.description: Very neat little, high-quality game. It's quite difficult though.

games.title: Overcooked!
games.description: Perfect game to play with your friends and destroy your friendships with! Absolutely hectic cooking fun!

games.title: Super Mario Odyssey
games.description: Best Mario game ever. It's so beautiful, fun, and lovely. I can't believe it took me so long to play this.

games.title: Keep Talking and Nobody Explodes
games.description: A must-have communicative co-op game if you like solving puzzles! The gameplay is really unique because one person has to have the actual printed-out handbook in his hand.

games.title: The Wiki Game
games.description: This is free to play in your browser. Basically, you have to browse Wikipedia and find a certain article before your opponents do, using only the links in articles. It's super fun.

games.title: Stardew Valley
games.description: I grew up with Harvest Moon, so this was a must. It's a really great farming game in a retro style, and there is a lot of content, even for late-game!

games.title: Battleblock Theater
games.description: If you're looking for a fun platformer to play in local multiplayer, I highly recommend this one. It's also really funny.

games.title: GeoGuessr
games.description: Unfortunately not free-to-play anymore (except once a day), but it's just so great.

games.title: Neko Atsume
games.description: This is my favorite mobile game because it's not addicting, it's so relaxing and you never spend a lot of time in the app because the whole point is to come back later and see which cute kitties have visited you. Even my mom loves this.

youtube.title: Game Grumps
youtube.description: Game Grumps are Arin and Dan, two friends who have been making gaming videos for over 10 years! If I had to choose one single youtube channel to watch for the rest of my life, this one would be it. They're wonderful and absolutely hilarious.

youtube.title: Danny Gonzalez
youtube.description: Danny is my favorite commentary youtuber out there. I have watched every single one of his videos 2-3 times. He is consistently entertaining and hilarious. He also makes great comedy music!

youtube.title: Drew Gooden
youtube.description: Drew has a hilarious deadpan humor and covers funny and interesting topics on his commentary channel. He was my introduction to 'commentary youtube' and I love him for it. I've seen all of his videos more than once.

youtube.title: Kurtis Conner
youtube.description: Kurtis completes the golden commentary trio (Danny, Drew, Kurtis). He also makes very funny videos, and recently has been making long-form videos on niche topics which are absolutely amazing!

youtube.title: Chad Chad
youtube.description: Chad Chad is yet another funny commentary youtuber! If you like Danny, Drew and Kurtis you will like her!

youtube.title: Jarvis Johnson
youtube.description: Jarvis is another great commentary youtuber. I especially like his more relaxed second-channel videos. He's great.

youtube.title: Jenny Nicholson
youtube.description: Jenny Nicholson is a commentary youtuber who usually makes (very-)long-form videos that are insane deep-dives into interesting niche (nerdy) topics.

youtube.title: Sam O'Nella Academy
youtube.description: Ugly and very entertaining animated videos about interested topics. Go ahead and binge it, you won't regret it.

youtube.title: Stephanie Lange
youtube.description: Stephanie makes great videos about the unhealthy and dangerous beauty standard for women today! A bresh of fresh air in today's internet.

youtube.title: Vsauce
youtube.description: If you haven't watched Vsauce -- what the hell are you doing? This is one of THE best science channels on youtube. Michael is is very charismatic and entertaining, and the videos are very interesting!

youtube.title: Domics
youtube.description: Domics is my favorite animator on YouTube. He makes funny videos about his life! Unfortunately he is not that active these days.

youtube.title: Good Mythical Morning
youtube.description: Good Mythical Morning is one of the best shows on youtube. Five times a week there's a main episode and some bonus content ('More'). Rhett and Link are life-long friends, and they and their crew create consistently entertaining videos!

youtube.title: Jay Foreman (Map Men)
youtube.description: Jay Foreman and Mark Cooper-Jones are the 'Map Men'! They make super intersting videos about geography, England, and so on, and their British humor is fucking hilarious!!

youtube.title: Micarah Tewers
youtube.description: Micarah is a seamstress and makes videos about that, but even if you're not interested in sewing I recommend her videos because she has a really cooky personality and an interesting life!

youtube.title: Matt Rose
youtube.description: Matt Rose reads out funny Reddit threats, tweets, etc, and he does it in a very entertaining way. Great for watching while waiting for the bus!

youtube.title: Watcher / Buzzfeed Unsolved
youtube.description: Buzzfeed Unsolved is one of the best YouTube shows I've ever seen. If you like cryptids, ghosts, or true crime you should definitely check it out! Their new channel is called Watcher.
youtube.cw: one of the shows is about true crime (murder etc)
